change.item: This finding aid was updated in alignment with LC EAD 2.0 specifications using a python script created by Erik Radio.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: One album containing original pen-and-ink drawings of mollusks. Includes both accepted and rejected proofs. The mounted plates often depict several different views. They are identified by the Latin name of the mollusk and the volume page number.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

did.langmaterial: Materials are in Latin and English.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Illustrations of J. Green (MS 165). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized by type.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: One album containing original pen-and-ink drawings of mollusks. Includes both accepted and rejected proofs. The mounted plates often depict several different views. They are identified by the Latin name of the mollusk and the volume page number.

relatedmaterial.p: Many of the illustrations were later published in volumes 2 and 3 of Mollusca, 1914 and 1921, by G.K. Gude. Volume 2 covers Trochomorphidae- janellidae; volume 3 is Land operculates. Mollusca is part of a larger monographic series titled The Fauna of British India, including Ceylon and Burma; A.E. Shipley is the editor. The series was published under the authority of the Secretary of State for India in Council, by Taylor & Francis, London, from 1908.
